message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.CR

This paper deals with the problem of person re-identification, which is a subfield of computer vision. The paper proposes a graph-based approach for spatial alignment in person re-identification, which involves both visual and spatial contexts. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also proposes a novel pose context descriptor and a similarity measure, which are related to machine learning and artificial intelligence, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. The paper also involves distance calculation and template ensemble, which are related to multimedia and multimodal processing, making cs.MM (Multimedia) another possible sub-category. The paper also involves graph matching and correspondence transfer, which are related to cryptography and security, making cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves optimization and efficiency, which are related to algorithms and complexity, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) another possible sub-category.
